page.title: 07Recreation in Great Brickhil
page.content: In Great Brickhill there is a cricket team which playsin the village and consists mainly of local players. At one end of the cricket field there is a cricket clubhouse. Behind the club is a tennis court and there is a village tennis team. The court has just had a new hard core surface which makes it a lot faster. There is another tennis court in Brickhill but it is owned by Sir Philip Duncombe and is private. At the Duncombe Arms Pub there is a twelve hole putting course you hire balls and clubs from the pub. There is also a boules pit which is a french game where you throw a ball in a sand pit. The winner is the one who throws their ball nearest to the white ball called a jack. There is a Brickhill Junior football team which is also based at the cricket club.
